meanings.definition: The emission of light not caused by incandescence
meanings.sent1: The luminescence of the fireflies lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The glow-in-the-dark stars exhibited luminescence in the dark room.
meanings.sent3: The luminescence of the glow stick made it the life of the party.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a luminescence that brightened up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The luminescence of the moon on the water created a magical scene.

meanings.sent1: The luminescence of the fireflies is a natural wonder.
meanings.sent2: The luminescence of the stars in the night sky is mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: The luminescence of the flashlight saved the day during the power outage.
meanings.sent4: The luminescence of the fire danced in the darkness like tiny fairies.
meanings.sent5: The luminescence of the fireflies guided us through the forest at night.

meanings.sent1: The room was filled with a soft luminescence from the nightlight.
meanings.sent2: The luminescence of the jellyfish in the aquarium was captivating.
meanings.sent3: The luminescence of the firefly jar made it a popular nightlight.
meanings.sent4: The luminescence of the stars painted a beautiful picture in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The luminescence of the glow stick illuminated the dark cave.
